timeline.bodyText: This is an auto feature not a private feature.  It should be in the auto directory and shouldn't be in a separate directory.  Only public features get their own directory.  With recent test updates your PB will fail due to this be in the wrong directory.
timeline.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: The PR to test that things are in the right directory is now in integration, so it will fail with your feature in this format.

timeline.message: re-organize copyFeaturePiiFiles and createFeatureResources

timeline.bodyText:
I'd rather not be using so many hard-coded versions in here. Where possible, I would like Open Liberty to use just one version of each dependency. It should be easy for us to a) know what our dependencies are and b) update that version in a single place to pull in fixes from upstream.
When I looked in the oss_dependencies.maven file, I was disappointed to find that we have multiple versions of jackson-annotations already.

  
    
      open-liberty/dev/cnf/oss_dependencies.maven
    
    
         Line 11
      in
      544f05a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:2.11.2
timeline.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText: after talking to Katie, we will address this in #15902
replies.author: aknguyen7

timeline.bodyText: Similar to my comment above. I'd rather not pull in specific versions here. Instead, use a common bundle and use the same version across Open Liberty. In this case you would put libs project(':io.openliberty.com.fasterxml.jackson') to pull in our existing bundle that includes version 2.11.2.
timeline.author: tevans78

+ *******************************************************************************/
+
+import groovy.json.JsonSlurper
+
+configurations {
+    libs
+    libs1
+    libs2
+    libs3
+    libs4
+    libs5
+    libs6
+    libs7
+    libs8
+    libs9
+    libs10
+}
+
+dependencies {
+    libs "com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:2.2.3"

timeline.bodyText:
Why is this auto-feature in a sub-folder? What is the benefit? Why not directly in
dev/com.ibm.websphere.appserver.features/visibility/auto ?
timeline.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText: Oh, I see... it's because of the additional NLS properties files. However, an auto-feature is private, it does not need any translation.
replies.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText: It isn't just nls properties files, but also icons needed for the admin center that are stored in the features directory in liberty.
replies.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: Storing icons (anything) in the features directory is rather unusual? It certainly isn't done for any other private OL feature. Why is this one different?
replies.author: tevans78

timeline.bodyText: Same comment as for the auto feature above. This is a private feature so it doesn't need translations. If the bundles need translated files then those NLS files would go in the bundle.
timeline.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText: Same comment here.
replies.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: We could combine the private features into the public one and not have extra nls files and just have all the icons in the public feature for the private feature.
replies.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: That's what openidConnectServer-1.0 does right? It still looks odd to me but at least there is precedence
replies.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText: Yeah I am guessing that these nls files are not needed because only public features need a feature description, right?
replies.author: jhanders34

timeline.bodyText: So this bundle builds differently if being run from the command line vs from eclipse or something else?
timeline.author: tevans78
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2016, 2017 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+#*******************************************************************************
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+Bundle-Name: WebSphere Admin Center Server Config Tool
+Bundle-SymbolicName: com.ibm.ws.ui.tool.serverConfig
+Bundle-Description: WebSphere Admin Center Server Config Tool, version ${bVersion}
+
+Web-ContextPath: /ibm/adminCenter/serverConfig-1.0
+OL-VirtualHost: ${admin.virtual.host}
+
+IBM-Authorization-Roles: com.ibm.ws.management
+
+Include-Resource: \
+  ${if;${driver;gradle};lib/orion_editor=lib/orion}, \

replies.bodyText: I believe this is to make things work well in eclipse without having to run gradle in order to build in eclipse.
replies.author: jhanders34
